channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2025030003
item.description:
Report I-2025030003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-07T00:50:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: Charlotte
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRANSFLO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the second load coming out of this car, operator was positioning himself to close the BOV valve to finish the load that is when a leak started. He immediately closed the BOV valve and cleared the line on the unit. After a minute the leak stopped allowing less than a pint of product to escape. The car was Red Tagged this car and are advising the shipper of the defect as this happened at the end of the transfer. The leak appears to be at the flange of the BOV.

item.title: Report X-2025030095
item.description:
Report X-2025030095

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THAT EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS FOUR FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF RESOLVE HIGH TRAFFIC FOAM CARPET CLEANER AT 22OZ EACH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1ZFA54760263701852. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF IN WISCONSIN USING UPS ACCOUNT FA5476, SAN DIEGO FUNDING, 2468 HISTORIC DECATUR RD, SAN DIEGO CA 92106-6148. IT IS SUSPECTED THE USAGE OF THIS ACCOUNT IS FRAUDULENT.

  • City: SAUGET

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 28, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged and released approximately two (2) quarts of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. The crew utilized a cleaning agent and absorbents to remove all released product. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:

  • City: MINNEAPOLIS

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER ON 2/25/24 AT 12:20 AM. THE PACKAGE CAME FROM THE RED SECONDARY. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR, 1 GALLON, PLASTIC JUGS OF MINNCARE HD DISINFECTANT, BEING SHIPPED AS A OXIDIZER/CORROSIVE HAZMAT PACKAGE, (UN3149, HYDROGEN PEROXIDE AND PEROXYACETIC ACID MIXTURES, STABILIZED, 5,1(8), II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 GALLON). THE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR PLASTIC BOTTLES, WAS LOOSE, WHIGH ALLOWED ABOUT, 1/2 GALLON OF THE MIXTURE, TO LEAK ONTO ALL INNER JUGS, PLUS THE OUTSIDE CARTON. 4 OTHER PACKAGES WERE ALSO STAINED BY THE MIXTURE ON THE SLIDE. THE HAZMAT PACKAGE, WERE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WAS NOTIFIED OF A HAZMAT PACKAGE TO BE PICKED UP AT BAY 441. WITH FULL PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. UPON ARRIVING INSIDE THE TRAILER, SAW THAT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. CHECKED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT AND NOTICED THAT THERE WAS SIGNS OF LEAKAGE, BUT RATHER THE SMELL IS COMING FROM THE INSIDE OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. GRABBED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT AND CONTAINED IT INSIDE A SPILL TUB. HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. LOOKING AT THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT, NOTICED THAT THERE WERE SIGNS OF THE HAZMAT BEING LEAKED ON FROM ANOTHER SOURCE ON MULTIPLE SIDES. WHEN OPENED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT, NOTICED THAT THE CAPS WERE LOOSE AND LEAKAGE OCCURED.

item.title: Report E-2025030045
item.description:
Report E-2025030045

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: WARREN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver was breaking down hose lines he was pulling vacuum to clear lines the pump began blowing material out of the exhaust of the pump. Driver was at the back of the trailer and did not notice it right away and when it was noticed the pump was shut down and absorbent wer put down to contain the material. The material was released onto pavement and no drains were affected. There was approximately 10 gallons released and a team was dispatched to perform the clean up. They were notified at 1545et and arrived at 1745et. Once they arrived they assessed the scene and began a plan for the clean up. PPE was dawned and the clean up began at 1830et. The material had frozen due to the extreme cold which helped prevent the material from spreading. The team used shovels and absorbents to collect the material and dispose of in the proper containers. The clean up was completed at 2030et.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 01:20 EST on 2/7, Edward Jones with XPO-NCH contacted ERTS to report a spill of roughly 15 gallons of "Thixon 511-EF" from a 55gal metal drum, impacting the trailer and dock floors. The drum was punctured by a forklift at NCH. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined the terminal needed additional PPE to clean the spill, citing goggles. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of UN1133 Thixon 511-EF product was released to the trailer floor and concrete due to forklift puncture. The drum was patched and overpacked into (1) 85-gallon poly drum and the spill was cleaned with absorbents. The spent absorbents were placed into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XNW contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon DF containing hazardous product, VORTEXX. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4x4 area as a result of improper loading. The contractor applied simple green to the release and overpacked the leaking drum into one 95-gallon DF for waste disposal. The impacted absorbent pads and PPE were containerized into a separate drum for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • City: INDIANAPOLIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/04/2025, at 14:20 hours, personnel in the CSXT Hawthorne Yard in Indianapolis, Indiana, discovered UTLX632003, tank car load of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, had residue adhering to the outside of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Shintech Louisiana LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-0204-00181). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and observed dried residue on the exterior of the car which appeared to have released from the tank cars pressure relief valve. No active leaks or apparent defects were observed. HEPACO personnel decontaminated the exterior of the tank car. All actions were communicated to the shippers representative (Patrick Hill). The car was initially held at FRAs request and subsequently moved under authority of an OTMA-1 (FRA-250213014).

item.description:
Report E-2025030019

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-01
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, they observed an estimated (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote that was cracked at the top of the tote from improper preparation for shipping. SET Environmental personnel observed that the released material impacted 3 ft-by-2 ft of trailer and concrete dock floor. SET Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized them along with the cut-up tote and PPE into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining material in the product tote was to be transferred to two (2) 275-gallon IBC tote. Generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030003
item.description:
Report X-2025030003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Ognibene, 026 Operation Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3265 corrosive liquid spill on the trailer and dock floor. John Ognibene advised he noticed the spill while walking the dock. John Ognibene stated it's unknown if any of the commodity struck the yard due to it being dark and the product being clear. John Ognibene advised both sides of the drum are caved in but is unknown if that's what caused the spill. John Ognibene stated the drum is still leaking so he moved the drum off the trailer, down the dock by the dumpster to be out of the way of workers. John Ognibene asked if h e could place wood chips over the spill and Safety advised yes to can contain the spill. Safety contacted Mattisyn Keys with Cura for remediation. ~~Safety advised Mattisyn Keys to advise Safety if any struck the yard and if the spill becomes reportable. Safety also requested the cause of the spill. ~~Update from Cura- "It took some time to get a contractor to respond earlier this morning. The crew just wrapped up at the terminal, completing removal of the environmental concern. The drums looked to have been compressed inside the trailer, causing the release. I am not finding any ingredients o n this product to be reportable."

  • City: FREDERICKSBURG

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A 5 gallon container of sodium hydroxide solution was punctured by an exposed nail in a pallet. The Veolia employee identified that the container was leaking and it was removed from the truck immediately. The spill was cleaned from the trailer floor and the dock floor. It is estimated that 3 ounces of material were spilled. The 5 gallon container and spill cleanup were overpacked into a 30 gallon drum without further incident. The pallet was cut into pieces sent for disposal as well.

item.title: Report E-2025020413
item.description:
Report E-2025020413

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: E-2025020413 AT THE UPS AIR CARGO MIAMI FACILITY A SHIPPER PREBUILT UNIT (PBU) AAD99364UPS DESTINED FOR COLOMBIA UNDERWENT CONTENT SCREENING PROCESS. AMONG THE PACKAGES WAS A BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED SKID THAT WAS INSPECTED. ONE FIBERBOARD BOX WITH AN AREA SHAPED AS A DIAMOND CUT FROM THE BOX WAS DISCOVERED. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE CONTENTS REVEALED ONE ROINSIDE UP8 PRO SMART E-SCOOTER WITH AN INSTALLED RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY. E-2025020415 AT THE UPS AIR CARGO MIAMI FACILITY A SHIPPER PREBUILT UNIT (PBU) AAD1445UPS DESTINED FOR COLOMBIA UNDERWENT CONTENT SCREENING PROCESS. IN BETWEEN THE BOXES INSIDE THE AIR CONTAINER WAS A SODASTREAM TERRA BONUS PACK BOX WITH A PREPRINTED NONFLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. INNER PACKAGE INSPECTION DOES FIND A SODASTREAM COMPRESSED CYLINDERS INSIDE. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE NOT ALLOWED IN SHIPPER PRE-BUILT UNITS.

Also if it was water you could have shipped it in plastic contianers.

item.title: Report X-2025021182
item.description:
Report X-2025021182

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/01/2025 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping down the sides of tank car CBTX 726095 while performing switching operations at the CN Geismar Yard in Geismar, LA. The employee notified the on duty transportation manager who then made notification to the CN Dangerous Goods Team. An emergency response contractor was dispatched to the incident for mitigation. The contractor#s assessment noted dried spillage on both sides of the tank car upon arrival. The spillage appeared to be emanating from the manway cover which had an intact security cable seal applied. Further inspection revealed that (2) of the (8) manway cover swing bolts were found to be less than tool tight and could easily be turned by hand. The remaining (6) swing bolts could easily be turned with a pipe wrench with minimal force therefore not creating a proper seal which allowed the contents to leak out during transportation. The manway cover gasket was also inspected and appeared to be in a usable condition. The manway cover swing bolts were tightened in a star pattern with a 24" pipe wrench.

item.description:

  • City: HATTIESBURG

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2025021177-On 01/30/2025 a CN transportation employee observed liquid coming from the top and running down the side of tank car # TILX 198075 (Loaded / Alcohols N.O.S. / UN 1987 / Class 3) at the CN Hattiesburg Yard located in Hattiesburg, MS. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team that responded to the incident. The responding DG Officer noted dried spillage on the sides of all 4 of the tank car upon arrival. Further assessment the manway cover swing bolts were less than tool-tight and could easily be turned by hand allowing the contents to leak during transportation due to an improper seal of the manway covers. Shipper-applied security seals were found to be intact at the time of assessment. The manway cover was opened for the purpose of inspecting the gasket followed by the tightening of the swing bolts in a star pattern with a 24# pipe wrench. The tank car was released for continued transportation to destination. There was no ground contamination, exposures or injuries as a result of the leak. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team that responded to the incident. The responding DG Officer noted dried spillage on the sides of all 4 of the tank car upon arrival. Further assessment the manway cover swing bolts were less than tool-tight and could easily be turned by hand allowing the contents to leak during transportation due to an improper seal of the manway covers. Shipper-applied security seals were found to be intact at the time of assessment. The manway cover was opened for the purpose of inspecting the gasket followed by the tightening of the swing bolts in a star pattern with a 24# pipe wrench. The tank car was released for continued transportation to destination. There was no ground contamination, exposures or injuries as a result of the leak.

D&H Petroleum & Environnmental Services personnel deployed granular absorbents to impacted area. The spent absorbents were recovered and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. item.description:
Report X-2025021184

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: HATTIESBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Illinois Central Railroad Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/30/2025 a CN transportation employee observed liquid coming from the top and running down the side of tank car # TILX 191769 (Loaded / Alcohols N.O.S. / UN 1987 / Class 3) at the CN Hattiesburg Yard located in Hattiesburg, MS. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team that responded to the incident. The responding DG Officer noted dried spillage on the sides of all 4 of the tank car upon arrival. Further assessment the manway cover swing bolts were less than tool-tight and could easily be turned by hand allowing the contents to leak during transportation due to an improper seal of the manway covers. Shipper-applied security seals were found to be intact at the time of assessment. The manway cover was opened for the purpose of inspecting the gasket followed by the tightening of the swing bolts in a star pattern with a 24# pipe wrench. The tank car was released for continued transportation to destination. There was no ground contamination, exposures or injuries as a result of the leak.

item.title: Report I-2025020068
item.description:
Report I-2025020068

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: Portland
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11201
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Order was placed for material for 1900 gallons. Tank was a 1550-gallon tank, drivers are instructed to fill tanks to 7/8 to allow room for them to blow out their lines. The driver arrived onsite and hooked up to the tank without any incident. o l. On most occasions the entire load of material should fit into the tank and near the end of the load is when you tend to have issues where the tank gets full. Driver filled tank and initially reported that there was a 5-15 gallon spill out of the top of the tank when he was blowing out his line. . On 01/22/25 when we received the paperwork and telemetry on the tank it was calculated the actual amount of the spill was 642 gallons. This is above the RQ of 1 0001bs. This was reported to NCR# 1422616 on 01/22/25. A clean-up crew (TAZ Environmental) was contracted to clean the containment area. PVS learned that Ferric Chloride had been pumped into frac tanks from containment and needed to be cleaned out and contracted a new remediation company Miller Septic was contracted. Clean-up of the Ferric Chloride material has been completed.
